item.title: Cacambas Levtec Rossetti v1.0 ETS2
item.description:

Cacambas Levtec Rossetti v1.0 ETS2

You’re asking about Levtec and Rossetti dump truck bodies/trailers (“Caçambas”) as mods for Euro Truck Simulator 2 (ETS2). These are well-known Brazilian manufacturers of heavy-duty equipment, and their dump bodies are indeed popular subjects for modders in the ETS2 community, especially among players who enjoy the Brazilian trucking scene.

When you’re looking for “Caçambas Levtec Rossetti” for ETS2, you’re generally looking for:
Standalone Trailer Mods: These are specific dump trailers that you can attach to your truck. They will often come with different configurations, capacities, and visual details specific to Levtec or Rossetti designs.
Chassis-Specific Add-ons: Sometimes, the dump body is designed to fit onto a specific truck chassis mod (e.g., a custom Brazilian truck mod like a VW Constellation, Mercedes-Benz Axor, or Volvo VM). This creates a complete rigid dump truck.
Cargo & Jobs: These mods integrate with the game’s cargo system, allowing you to pick up and deliver loads like sand, gravel, dirt, and other bulk materials.

Key Features You Can Expect from Levtec/Rossetti Caçamba Mods:
Detailed Models: Modders strive to create highly accurate representations of these real-life dump bodies, including:
Realistic textures and materials (metal, paint, hydraulic cylinders).
Working rear doors/tailgates.
Detailed chassis and suspension elements.
Brand badging (Levtec, Rossetti).
Animation: Many mods feature animations for the dump body’s operation (tilting up and down), though the actual cargo loading/unloading animation within ETS2 is generic.
Variations: You might find different types of dump bodies:
Conventional Rear Dump: The most common type, dumping from the back.
Side Dump: Less common as a mod, but some might exist.
Different Capacities: Representing various real-world volume capacities.

Customization: Some mods may offer options for:
Different paint schemes.
Accessory slots for lights or other small details.
Integration with Map Mods: These types of mods are particularly popular when playing on large Brazilian map mods (like Mapa EAA, Mapa RBR, or Brazil Total), as they provide suitable roads, quarries, construction sites, and industries for dump truck operations.
Compatibility: Generally compatible with recent ETS2 game versions. Always check the mod’s description for specific version requirements.

item.title: Campione Invictus DD 15M Mercedes v1.0 ETS2
item.description:
Euro Truck Simulator 2 Mods | American Truck Simulator Mods | June 7, 2025

Campione Invictus DD 15M Mercedes v1.0 ETS2

The Comil Campione Invictus DD (Double Decker) 15M, especially with a Mercedes-Benz chassis, is a highly sought-after bus mod for Euro Truck Simulator 2 (ETS2). These luxurious double-decker buses are a staple on long-distance routes in Brazil and other South American countries, and their digital counterparts in ETS2 offer an immersive and detailed passenger transport experience.

Here’s a breakdown of what you can expect from a Comil Campione Invictus DD 15M Mercedes mod for ETS2:

Key Features and Aspects:
Highly Detailed Model: The Invictus DD mods are known for their exceptional attention to detail. This includes:
Exterior: Accurate replication of the bus’s iconic design, including lights, windows, luggage compartments, and intricate body lines.
Interior (Upper and Lower Decks): This is where these mods truly shine. You’ll often find:
Detailed driver’s cabin with a realistic dashboard, working gauges, and interactive buttons.
Accurately modeled passenger seats (often with variations like conventional, semi-bed, or full-bed options).
Restroom facilities, staircases, and often even snack bar/kitchenette areas on the lower deck.
Ambient lighting.
Mercedes-Benz Chassis: When specified as “Mercedes,” it typically means the mod is based on a real-life Mercedes-Benz chassis like the O-500RSDD (often O-500RSDD Bluetec 5 or Euro 6), which is common for double-decker buses in Brazil. This implies:
Realistic Engine and Transmission: Authentic engine power (e.g., 408hp, 420hp, 450hp, depending on the specific O-500RSDD variant) and torque, paired with appropriate Mercedes-Benz transmissions (e.g., ZF AS-Tronic).
Handling Characteristics: The physics are usually adapted to simulate the weight and handling of a large double-decker bus.

Animations: Expect a wide range of animations for increased realism:
Doors: Animated passenger entrance doors (both decks, if applicable), luggage compartment doors, and driver’s cabin door.
Interior Controls: Animated handbrake, pedals, wipers, and various dashboard switches.
Suspension: Realistic suspension movement.

Skins and Customization:
Vast Skin Packs: One of the biggest attractions of bus mods is the sheer number of real-life company skins (paint jobs) available, especially for Brazilian and South American operators.

Customization Options: Modders often include options for:
Different types of seats.
Curtains and interior textures.
Wheel options (original Mercedes-Benz or custom bus wheels).
Accessory slots for cabin accessories (compatible with SiSL’s Mega Pack).
Customizable destination signs (letreiros) with various route names.
Realistic Sounds: High-quality sound packs are essential, including:
Authentic Mercedes-Benz engine sounds (often using sound mods like those by Rafasound).
Air brake sounds, gear shifts, horn, and internal sounds like door closing/opening.
Passenger Transport System: The mod will integrate with ETS2’s passenger system, allowing you to pick up and drop off passengers at bus stations (often requiring compatible map mods).
Compatibility: Designed to work with recent ETS2 game versions. It’s crucial to check the mod’s description for specific version compatibility. These mods are best enjoyed with large, detailed map mods that feature bus stations and realistic road networks, such as:
Mapa EAA (Elite da Estrada): One of the most popular and comprehensive Brazilian map mods.
Mapa RBR (Rotas Brasileiras): Another excellent Brazilian map.
Other regional South American map mods.

item.title: Busscar Jum Buss 380 Multichassi ETS2 v1.0 ETS2
item.description:
Euro Truck Simulator 2 Mods | American Truck Simulator Mods | June 7, 2025

Busscar Jum Buss 380 Multichassi ETS2 v1.0 ETS2

The Busscar Jum Buss 380 is a classic and very popular Brazilian intercity bus model, and mods for it are indeed available for Euro Truck Simulator 2 (ETS2). The “Multichassi” aspect means that the mod typically allows you to choose from various real-life chassis options (like Volvo, Scania, Mercedes-Benz), each with its own engine sounds and driving characteristics.

Here’s a breakdown of what you can expect from a Busscar Jum Buss 380 Multichassi mod for ETS2:

Busscar Jum Buss 380 Multichassi for ETS2

1. Authentic Model:
Exterior: Modders strive for a highly detailed and accurate recreation of the Jum Buss 380, capturing its iconic design from its era. This includes detailed lights, windows, and overall body shape.
Interior: The interior will also be modeled, featuring a realistic dashboard with animated gauges and controls, as well as passenger seating, aiming to provide an authentic bus driver experience.

2. “Multichassi” Feature:
This is a key aspect. It means the mod isn’t locked to just one chassis. You’ll typically find options for:
Volvo: Often includes chassis like the B10M, B12B, B12R, or newer ones, each with its specific engine sounds and power outputs.
Scania: Common options include the K113, K124, K360, or K400, offering different Scania engine tones and performance.
Mercedes-Benz: Chassis like the O-400RSD or O-500RS/RSD are frequently included, providing the distinct Mercedes sound and feel.
Each chassis option will have its own realistic engine power, torque, and transmission choices (e.g., ZF, Scania Opticruise, Volvo I-Shift, manual gearboxes).

3. Realistic Sounds:
A major selling point of these mods is often the custom sound packs. You can expect authentic engine sounds for each chassis variant (Volvo, Scania, Mercedes-Benz), along with realistic air brake sounds, horn, door sounds, and internal bus noises.

4. Customization:
Skins (Liveries): A wide variety of skins representing real Brazilian and South American bus companies are usually included or available as separate skin packs.
Accessories: Options for customizing external accessories like lights, mirrors, and sometimes interior elements like curtains or cabin accessories (often compatible with SiSL’s Mega Pack).
Destination Boards (Letreiros): Many mods feature customizable destination signs to display your current route.

5. Passenger Transport Integration:
The mod will fully integrate with ETS2’s passenger system. You can pick up and drop off passengers at bus stations, allowing you to take on various intercity routes.
This is especially immersive when combined with large Brazilian map mods (like Mapa EAA, Mapa RBR, or others) that feature detailed bus terminals and suitable road networks.

6. Compatibility:
Bus mods are generally updated for newer ETS2 game versions, but it’s crucial to always check the mod’s description for the specific game version it supports. Running an outdated mod on a new game version can lead to crashes or graphical glitches.
